title: Methods
text: package uses three main inputs: GCAM-USA model outputs, GCAM-USA input data assumptions, employment factors JEDI model. GCAM-USA provides annual power output projections (exajoules, EJ) technology vintage model period. model calibrated base year (2015) projects output every five years 2100. Since JEDI employment factors based capacity, need data GCAM-USA electricity outcomes capacity terms, including operational capacity, newly installed capacity, retired capacity. However, GCAM-USA directly track capacity levels. Therefore, derive capacity information annual power generation outcomes supplementary data capacity factors (.e., ratio electrical energy produced generating unit period time considered electrical energy produced continuous full capacity period.) GCAM-USA input data assumptions used provide (1) capacity factor technology, (2) power plant retirement pattern, (3) variable fixed operation maintenance (O&M) cost. Capacity factors retirement assumptions help derive capacity levels operational, newly installed, retired capacity. variable fixed O&M costs used differentiate corresponding variable fixed O&M employment factors JEDI. Note GCAM-USA include capacity factors hydropower geothermal power. Therefore, use alternative data sources. hydropower, use monthly state-level capacity factors from1, annual state-level average used package. geothermal power, due limited data, use capacity factor 0.76, based estimates U.S. EIA2. Annual employment factors (EF) derived JEDI used , cases, modified supplementary data from3 calculate number jobs based power plant activities. Specifically, JEDI provides job outcomes specified type project, calculate EF dividing number jobs project’s capacity. mapping GCAM-USA’s power generation capacity fuel type JEDI’s specific model used calculate corresponding EF shown table . details adjustments EF described Jobs Calculation.

title: Methods
text: GCAM-USA, electricity generation results reported fuel (), technology (k), year (t), vintage (v), “vintage” refers year power plant unit built. Based results, analysis distinguishes electricity generation activity (), generation existing operational newly added power plants, also estimates retired capacity. Key concepts formulas include: Power operational capacity electricity generated year t units still operation built vintage v: EJi,k,tv,op=EJi,k,tv EJ_{,k,t}^{v,op}=EJ_{,k,t}^v EJi,k,tvEJ_{,k,t}^v observed generation vintage v GCAM-USA results. Potential generation non-retired installed capacity maximum electricity generated year t installed units built vintage v, assuming running typical capacity. differs actual electricity generated operational capacity, units may temporarily shut due market conditions, reduce power operational capacity affect potential generation installed capacity. estimate value GCAM-USA output, assume potential generation vintage v period t maximum generation observed year t onward: EJi,k,tv,=maxT≥t(EJi,k,Tv,op) EJ_{,k,t}^{v,}=\max_{\substack{T\geq t}} \left(EJ_{,k,T}^{v,op}\right) approach assumes temporary shutdown units reducing power generation period t, shutdown end future period, time generation increase maximum potential. units temporary shutdown period t still considered part non-retired installed capacity period t, related fixed OM employment factors. Power newly installed capacity electricity generated capacity added year t (.e., generation year t new builds year t): EJi,k,tv,add=EJi,k,tv=t EJ_{,k,t}^{v,add}=EJ_{,k,t}^{v=t} Power Loss Retired Capacity change installed generation potential years t-1 t, representing retirements: EJi,k,tv,ret=EJi,k,tv,−EJi,k,t−1v,EJ_{,k,t}^{v,ret}=EJ_{,k,t}^{v,}-EJ_{,k,t-1}^{v,} Note unlike technologies, wind solar generation GCAM-USA v7.1 require careful handling due intermittent nature (e.g., wind depends weather; solar depends daylight). ensure stable electricity supply, GCAM-USA includes backup power, generated wind/solar therefore excluded capacity job calculations wind/solar. Rooftop PV GCAM-USA currently vintaged; thus, requires post-processing establish vintage structure based observed power output retirement assumptions. example available . GCAM-USA directly track power plant capacity (GW). Instead, provides electricity generation outputs (EJ), can derive capacity levels using capacity factors (CF), reflect much theoretical maximum capacity actually utilized time. Correspondingly, four types capacity generation data: Operational capacity (capacity associated actual generation) GWi,k,tv,op=EJi,k,tv,opCFi,k,t GW_{,k,t}^{v,op}=\frac{EJ_{,k,t}^{v,op}}{CF_{,k,t}} Installed capacity (theoretical maximum generation capacity available, regardless whether ’s fully utilized) GWi,k,tv,=EJi,k,tv,inCFi,k,t GW_{,k,t}^{v,}=\frac{EJ_{,k,t}^{v,}}{CF_{,k,t}} Newly installed capacity year t GWi,k,tv,add=EJi,k,tv,addCFi,k,t GW_{,k,t}^{v,add}=\frac{EJ_{,k,t}^{v,add}}{CF_{,k,t}} Retired capacity periods GWi,k,tv,ret=EJi,k,tv,retCFi,k,t GW_{,k,t}^{v,ret}=\frac{EJ_{,k,t}^{v,ret}}{CF_{,k,t}} Note operational capacity may lower installed capacity plants can shut temporarily economic reasons. considered retirements, just underutilization. Fixed O&M jobs (e.g., regular maintenance) assumed linked installed capacity, whether ’s operating. Variable O&M jobs (e.g., fuel handling, operations) associated operational capacity . Regarding capacity retirement, two types GCAM-USA: natural retirement (GWi,k,tv,nat_retGW_{,k,t}^{v,\ nat\_ret}) premature retirement (GWi,k,tv,pre_retGW_{,k,t}^{v,\ pre\_ret}). Capacity installed 2015 grouped single 2015 vintage, retired naturally time using S-curve. Capacity added 2015 retires end lifetime. Premature retirement occurs power plant shuts end lifetime due economic non-viability (.e., longer profitable). total retirement exceeds natural retirement, excess treated premature retirement. GCAM-USA allows new capacity added older capacity retired year. reflects reality larger states (e.g., California, Texas) many facilities, can problematic small states facilities. Therefore, design two user-defined method options handle : Total Method (suited large states), capacity additions retirements counted separately:GWi,k,tv,retGW_{,k,t}^{v,ret} GWi,k,taddGW_{,k,t}^{add}.Thus, job calculations depend total capacity two. Net Method (suited small states), premature retirement offset capacity addition: Net retirement: GWi,k,tv,ret*=GWi,k,tv,nat_ret+max(0,GWi,k,tv,pre_ret−GWi,k,tadd) GW_{,k,t}^{v,ret\ast}=GW_{,k,t}^{v,nat\_ret}+\max{\left(0,GW_{,k,t}^{v,pre\_ret}-GW_{,k,t}^{add}\right)} Net addition: GWi,k,tv,add*=max(0,GWi,k,tadd−GWi,k,tv,pre_ret) GW_{,k,t}^{v,add\ast}=\max{\left(0,GW_{,k,t}^{add}-GW_{,k,t}^{v,pre\_ret}\right)} distinction ensures job estimates capacity expansion decommissioning remain realistic regionally appropriate.

title: Methods
text: Job calculations performed based capacities described . focus four direct jobs categories power generation sector: Construction jobs, including onsite construction jobs construction-related jobs (e.g., design project management) Fixed Operation & Maintenance (O&M) jobs Variable O&M jobs Decommissioning jobs capacity retired category tied specific type capacity activity: JEDI provides single O&M employment factor EFOMJEDIEF_{OM}^{JEDI}, includes fixed variable jobs, based capacity (MW). However, two important adjustments needed GCAM-USA: 1) separate variable fixed O&M Jobs, GCAM-USA allows temporary plant shutdowns economic reasons, 2) adjust load segments, GCAM-USA models different load segments (base, peak, etc.), different capacity factors. temporary plant shutdowns, fixed O&M jobs continue, variable O&M jobs reduce. disaggregate JEDI EF, assume labor shares follow fixed versus variable O&M cost shares GCAM assumptions: EFOM,basevar=($OMvar$OMvar+$OMfix)EFOMJEDI EF_{OM,base}^{var} = \left( \frac{\$_{OM}^{var}}{\$_{OM}^{var} + \$_{OM}^{fix}} \right) EF_{OM}^{JEDI} EFOM,basefix=($OMfix$OMvar+$OMfix)EFOMJEDI EF_{OM,base}^{fix} = \left( \frac{\$_{OM}^{fix}}{\$_{OM}^{var} + \$_{OM}^{fix}} \right) EF_{OM}^{JEDI} non-base-load plants operate fewer hours per year, variable O&M jobs lower. scale variable O&M EF using ratio CF base-load CF: EFOM,nonbasevar=(CFnonbaseCFbase)EFOM,basevar EF_{OM,nonbase}^{var}=\left(\frac{CF_{nonbase}}{CF_{base}}\right)EF_{OM,base}^{var} However, note fixed O&M EF affected operation hours based installed capacity: EFOM,nonbasefix=EFOM,basefix EF_{OM,nonbase}^{fix}=EF_{OM,base}^{fix} JEDI reports construction jobs total full-time equivalents entire construction period. example, 40 full-time equivalents build 2-year project mean 20 full-time jobs per year 2 years. use data JEDI annual GCAM-USA outputs, calculate annualized construction job EFs: AnnualEF=NT⋅C \mathrm{Annual\ EF}=\frac{N}{T\cdot C} N total construction full-time equivalents; T construction period (years); C project capacity (MW). However, GCAM-USA runs 5-year time-steps, timing adjustments needed. T ≤ 5 (construction fits within one GCAM period): AnnualEF=N5C \mathrm{Annual\ EF}=\frac{N}{5C} , jobs assigned evenly 5-year GCAM period. T > 5 (construction spans multiple GCAM periods): show example projects spanning two GCAM periods. case, t - 4 t (last 5 years construction): EFt=NTC {\mathrm{EF}}_t=\frac{N}{TC} t - 9 t - 5 (earlier years): EFt−5=NTC(T−55) {\mathrm{EF}}_{t-5}=\frac{N}{TC}\left(\frac{T-5}{5}\right) splits total construction jobs appropriate GCAM-USA time windows average annual basis. provide specific example, case nuclear capacity construction, due absence specific construction period data JEDI, assume 8-year construction period based NREL ATB data8. Assume GCAM-USA shows 10 MW nuclear capacity added 2050. T = 8 years, construction period spans two GCAM-USA periods (10 years two 5-year time-steps). annual construction EF (jobs/MW/year) 2046–2050 (last 5 years) : EF2050=NTC {\mathrm{EF}}_{2050}=\frac{N}{TC} 2041–2045 (last 3 years 5-year time period construction going ), average annual construction EF 5-year time window : EF2045=NTC(8−55) {\mathrm{EF}}_{2045}=\frac{N}{TC}\left(\frac{8-5}{5}\right) result, number construction jobs due 10MW addition 10 times {EF}_{2050} 2050 10 times EF2045{\mathrm{EF}}_{2045} 2045. _________ Hall, D., Hunt, R., Reeves, K. & Carroll, G. Estimation Economic Parameters U.S. Hydropower Resources. None, 1218138, 3750 https://www.osti.gov/servlets/purl/1218138/ (2003) doi:10.2172/1218138. EIA. Nearly half U.S. geothermal power capacity came online 1980s - U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA). https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=42036 (2019). Xie, J. J., Martin, M., Rogelj, J. & Staffell, . Distributional labour challenges opportunities decarbonizing US power system. Nat. Clim. Change 13, 1203–1212 (2023).

title: package_vignette
text: step reads GCAM output interest alternative file types. Use local GCAM output database Use local project data Use default data (GCAM-USA 7.1 reference) package
code: prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'db',                         input_path = "C:/GODEEP/GCAM7/output",                         db_name = "database_basexdbGCAM-USA_Ref",                         scen_name = "GCAM-USA_Ref", # this needs to match the scenario name specified in the DB                         prj_name = "mydata.dat") # you name it prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'prj',                 input_path = "C:/GODEEP/",                 prj_name = "package.dat") prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'prj',                 input_path = system.file("extdata", package = "GCAMUSAJobs"),                 prj_name = "package.dat")

what: Step2: calculate detailed power generation outcomes
title: package_vignette
text: step queries power generation GCAM output, provides generation capacity operation, calculates implied power generation associated installed capacity, newly added capacity, retired capacity. specific types generation (“activities”) calculated : Capacity operation: running, installed; Capacity addition: additions, add_adj; Capacity retirements: retirements, natural_retire, early_retire, early_ret_adj, ret_adj. “_adj” activities indicate different methods calculation (net vs. total, see Step 4). Please refer documentation (https://github.com/JGCRI/GCAMUSAJobs/blob/paper/docs/tutorials/Documentation_GCAMUSAJobs.docx) details. power generation output annual, broken state, fuel type, technology. step takes 20 seconds execute generate output given scenario. Show subset outcomes

ℹ 2 more variables: capacity.factor <dbl>, fuel <chr> head(EJ_activity %>% filter(region == "CA", Year == 2050), 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 10 #>    scenario     region subsector        technology   Year Units   value activity #>    <chr>        <chr>  <chr>            <chr>       <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    #>  1 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_base_storage CSP_base_s…  2050 EJ    8.70e-3 running  #>  2 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_int          CSP_int(dr…  2050 EJ    2.79e-2 running  #>  3 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_int          CSP_int(re…  2050 EJ    2.79e-2 running  #>  4 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(d…  2050 EJ    6.37e-4 running  #>  5 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(r…  2050 EJ    6.37e-4 running  #>  6 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    4.83e-3 running  #>  7 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    4.83e-3 running  #>  8 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_base_storage  PV_base_st…  2050 EJ    1.79e-3 running  #>  9 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_int           PV_int       2050 EJ    1.57e-1 running  #> 10 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_peak          PV_peak      2050 EJ    3.57e-3 running  #> # title: package_vignette
text: step calculates jobs based capacity activity outcome Step 3, providing annual jobs job type, state, fuel type, load segment (base, intermittent, sub-peak, peak). function accepts two arguments: first capacity outcome Step 3, second optional method indicator. Total method used (default), capacity additions pre-mature retirements within region can occur simultaneously technology, jobs calculated capacity activities. Net method, assumes capacity addition pre-mature retirement don’t happen period technology within period, jobs calculated based net capacity changes. Default: use Total method Specify use Total method Specify use Net method Compare outcomes Total Net methods
code: JOB_activity <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity) JOB_activity2 <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity, "Total") JOB_activity3 <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity, "Net") JOB_activity3 %>%    dplyr::rename(Net = value) %>%    dplyr::left_join(JOB_activity %>% dplyr::rename(Total = value),                    by = c("scenario", "region", "Year", "fuel", "subsector", "job", "Units")) %>%    dplyr::filter(region %in% c("CA", "TX"), Year == 2025, subsector == "gas_peak_CC") %>%    dplyr::arrange(region) %>%    head(15) #> # A tibble: 12 × 9 #>    scenario     region  Year fuel  subsector   Units job               Net Total #>    <chr>        <chr>  <dbl> <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>           <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_fixed           72    72 #>  2 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_var              1     1 #>  3 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_total           73    73 #>  4 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-o…     0     1 #>  5 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-r…     0     1 #>  6 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Decommission      102   103 #>  7 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_fixed          177   177 #>  8 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_var              1     1 #>  9 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_total          178   178 #> 10 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-o…     0     3 #> 11 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-r…     0     2 #> 12 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Decommission      217   221

title: Tool for project jobs based on GCAM-USA results
text: GCAMUSAJobs aims provide employment projections power sector based GCAM-USA output. Specifically, package developed post-process electric power projections GCAM-USA, enabling estimation future power sector jobs state-level generation technology job type. Currently, GCAM-USA calculate power sector jobs. GCAMUSAJobs extends GCAM-USA functionality (1) estimating power plant capacity levels different activities – operational capacity, capacity addition, retirement; (2) calculating jobs associated activities, including jobs operation maintenance (O&M), construction, decommissioning. Workflow GCAMUSAJobs  GCAMUSAJobs utilizes GCAM-USA annual electricity generation outputs estimate underlying capacity levels based assumptions capacity factors calculate associated power sector jobs based employment factors. employment factor represents average number jobs created per unit power plant activity (e.g., jobs per gigawatt). method widely used relevant literature1,2. GCAMUSAJobs adopts employment factors NREL’s Jobs & Economic Development Impacts (JEDI) model, broadly used literature1,3,4. tool focuses estimating direct jobs power sector, meaning employment directly involved construction, operation, decommissioning power plants, opposed indirect induced jobs broader economy. functionality supports need assessing distributional labor impacts energy system transition. Back Contents
